references.paper_title: Mole: a molecular foundation model for drug discovery
references.reason: This paper introduces a foundational model for molecular drug discovery, establishing a key concept relevant to the current work on molecular data pruning.

references.paper_title: Scaling laws for neural language models
references.reason: This paper establishes scaling laws for neural language models, a foundational concept informing the understanding of model scaling and efficiency in the context of molecular learning.

references.paper_title: Neural message passing for quantum chemistry
references.reason: This paper introduces neural message passing for quantum chemistry, a crucial method used in many molecular machine learning applications, making it highly relevant to the current study.

references.paper_title: Understanding black-box predictions via influence functions
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of influence functions to understand black-box predictions, providing a theoretical basis for assessing data importance in the context of data pruning.

references.paper_title: Coresets via bilevel optimization for continual learning and streaming
references.reason: This paper discusses coresets via bilevel optimization, a key method used for efficient training and data summarization in continual learning and streaming settings which are highly relevant to the current work.
